result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael Charles Van Ness was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Michael Charles Van Ness was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CM131, 16CM129, 16TR158 and 16TR159:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Michael Charles Van Ness appeared. Case called at 3:35 p.m.  Court notes these matters are set for a plea and sentencing agreement. Permission from Branch 3 to handle 16CM129. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement and recommendations.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 2 & 3 in 16CM129. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia and Ct 3 OWI 3rd in 16CM129. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct's 1, 4, 5 & 6 in 16CM129, 16CM131 in its entirety, 16TR158 and 16TR159. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

Count 2 in 16CM129:

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00. Bond to apply. Needs to set up a payment plan.

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00

Count 3 in 16CM129:

- Fine in the amount of $1,744.00

- AODA and follow through with recommendations

- Impose 45 day jail sentence. Needs to report today. Zero days jail credit. Huber granted for work 

- 24 month drivers license revocation

- 24 month IID

- DNA Sample
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CM129 (MH), 16CM131 (MH), 16TR158 & 16TR159 (PTC): 
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Megan Kelly    DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Michael Charles Van Ness appeared. Case called at 3:33 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a Motion Hearing. Atty Olson states 16CM129 Motion to Suppress and also on 16CM131 Motion regarding the stop. Court will hear 16CM129 first. State calls Officer Jents to the stand. S/T Daniel Jents. Officer with Hudson Police Dept. Direct by ADA Kelly. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Cross by Atty Olson. Redirect by ADA Kelly. Cross by Atty Olson. Witness excused. Court recesses at 4:13 p.m. Case recalled at 4:31 p.m. On Case 16CM131, ADA Kelly states the Motion is on the stop only. State calls Deputy Dustin Geisness to the stand. S/T Dustin Geisness. Direct by ADA Kelly. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Olson. Witness excused. Court DENIES motion in 16CM131. On file 16CM129, ADA Kelly gives argument. Atty Olson gives argument. Court finds probable cause for the stop. Court will suppress the statement regarding drinking. Court finds probable cause for the field sobriety tests. Regarding DE's additional statements made under arrest, Court suppresses all statements. Court finds probable cause for the search and denies the motion regarding the search. Atty Olson objects. ADA Kelly gives argument. Rebuttal by Atty Olson. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 04-04-2016 08:00 am

Bond on file.

INCLUDES 16CM129 and 16CM131

Baseline test today - report to the Jail.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Report every  Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Edward Minser,  DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad for today,  DF:  Michael Charles Vanness appeared.   Includes 16CM129, 16CM131, 16TR158 & 16TR159. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court confirms address.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all Counts/Cases.  Waive speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:00 am.
